overview_of_class: This course builds upon the fundamentals developed in CHEM 210-A,-B. It covers chemistry of polyfunctional compounds of biological and medicinal interest, as well as modern organic synthesis, bioorganic chemistry, and recent developments in organic chemistry. The laboratory provides training in qualitative organic analysis and multistep synthesis. Includes a Saturday laboratory (CHEM 230-C) from 9 a.m. to 1 p.m.
name: Organic Chemistry III
title: SCS CHEM 210-C-65 Organic Chemistry III

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course builds upon the fundamentals developed in CHEM 210-A,-B. It covers chemistry of polyfunctional compounds of biological and medicinal interest, as well as modern organic synthesis, bioorganic chemistry, and recent developments in organic chemistry. The laboratory provides training in qualitative organic analysis and multistep synthesis. Includes a Saturday laboratory (CHEM 230-C) from 9 a.m. to 1 p.m.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value:
Grade of C- or better in Chem 210-B and Chem 230-B; or by department permission.

Students registering for Chemistry 210-C must also enroll in the associated lab course, Chemistry 230-C.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value:
Class participation: Clicker Questions; in-class questions to which responses are submitted electronically.
2 Midterm Exams
Final Exam

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Organic Chemistry by L.G. Wade, 8th Edition. Pearson Turning Technologies Model QT or NXT Response Card ("Clicker").

descriptions.name: Class Notes
descriptions.value: Must be taken concurrently with CHEM 230-B.

subject: CHEM
